meanings.definition: To cut off branches from a tree or plant.
meanings.sent1: I will lop the overgrown branches from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used a saw to lop off the dead branches.
meanings.sent3: The tree looked surprised after I lopped off its branches.
meanings.sent4: She lopped away the unnecessary parts of the plant, like cutting away bad memories.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he lopped the branches, leaving the tree looking neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: A branch or limb that has been cut off.
meanings.sent1: The gardener collected the lops and piled them up for disposal.
meanings.sent2: A squirrel found a cozy spot to rest on the lop.
meanings.sent3: The lop from the tree made a perfect perch for the birds.
meanings.sent4: The lop lay on the ground, a reminder of the tree's pruning.
meanings.sent5: Children used the lop as a makeshift bridge over the small stream.
